content:
Posted: September 3, 2016
Product received for free
A Physics-Based Building / Puzzle Game


YouTube™ Video: ChaosTower || Physics-Based Building / Puzzle Game 

			Views: 48		

			#chaostower http://store.steampowered.com/app/354280/ ♦Add me on Steam: http://steamcommunity.com/id/desolater_iv/ ♦Twitter: https://twitter.com/DESOLATER_IV		

+ The gameplay is pretty basic but a lot of fun. You try to build a tower to a certian height and make sure it's stable enough to stay up for around 10 seconds. + A number of challenging obstacles you must overcome, like little toy trians that try to knock your tower over, wind, earthquakes, etc.+ This game is very nostalgic and makes you feel like a kid again. Especially if you enjoyed building tall free standing towers out of blocks.+ While the majority of the game you build towers, there are other modes where you construct bridges to get a car across a canyon, or defend a tower or city from enemies.+ Love the elevator music :)+ The physics are actually very realistic and work correctly. - I felt like there should have been a larger variety of blocks and items to use. You are a bit limited in creativity by having a select few while under a budget limit.

content:
Posted: February 26, 2016
												I bought this game under the misleading title of "tower defence". It's a 2D tower building block game with clunky controls and a horrible UI. And there are only 32 levels which would take maybe 2 hours to complete. This just reaks of amateur. For the price I'd usually say you can't go wrong, but in this case, save your money.
